top_categories.workout_context: Rad Dirt Fest's Colorado Rockies gravel (80%), Dirt roads (20%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Rad Dirt Fest's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
8,202ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
132ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Rad Dirt Fest, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Rad Dirt Fest, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
8,202ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rad Dirt Fest. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Colorado Rockies—high altitude technical terrain. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
62 miles on Colorado Rockies—high altitude technical terrain burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Rad Dirt Fest. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Low-cadence force work for 8,202ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rad Dirt Fest’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Rad Dirt Fest with 8,202ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude (2,200-3,000 m); Thin air.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Rad Dirt Fest demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: colorado rockies gravel (80%), dirt roads (20%), high altitude (2,200-3,000 m). Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 62 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of colorado rockies—high altitude technical terrain in Salida, Colorado.
